content.text: Create a Task with subagent_type "statusline-setup" and the prompt "Configure my statusLine from my shell PS1 configuration"
I'll configure your statusLine from your shell PS1 configuration using the statusline-setup agent.

input.prompt: Configure my statusLine from my shell PS1 configuration

message.content: Configure my statusLine from my shell PS1 configuration

content.text: I'll help you configure your statusLine from your shell PS1 configuration. Let me first check your shell configuration files to find your PS1 setting.

content.content:
1‚Üíunsetopt PROMPT_SP
     2‚ÜíENABLE_CORRECTION="false"
     3‚ÜíHIST_STAMPS="dd/mm/yy"
     4‚ÜíINSTALLER_NO_MODIFY_PATH=1
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üíexport LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíif [ -n "$TMUX" ]; then
     9‚Üí export TERM="tmux-256color"
    10‚Üíelse
    11‚Üí export TERM="xterm-256color" # Or another appropriate setting
    12‚Üífi
    13‚Üí
    14‚Üíexport COLORTERM="truecolor"
    15‚Üí
    16‚Üíautoload -U compinit; compinit
    17‚Üí
    18‚Üíexport GPG_TTY=$(tty)
    19‚Üígpgconf --launch gpg-agent > /dev/null 2>&1
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí# NOTE gopass workaround not working
    22‚Üí# source /dev/stdin <<<"$(gopass completion bash)"
    23‚Üí
    24‚Üí# sketchybar
    25‚Üí# This will update the brew package count after running a brew upgrade, brew
    26‚Üí# update or brew outdated command
    27‚Üí# Personally I added "list" and "install", and everything that is after but
    28‚Üí# that's just a personal preference.
    29‚Üí# That way sketchybar updates when I run those commands as well
    30‚Üíif command -v sketchybar &>/dev/null; then
    31‚Üí
    32‚Üí# Define a custom 'brew' function to wrap the Homebrew command.
    33‚Üífunction brew() {
    34‚Üí	# Execute the original Homebrew command with all passed arguments.
    35‚Üí	command brew "$@"
    36‚Üí	# Check if the command includes "upgrade", "update", or "outdated".
    37‚Üí	if [[ $* =~ "upgrade" ]] || [[ $* =~ "update" ]] || [[ $* =~ "outdated" ]] || [[ $* =~ "list" ]] || [[ $* =~ "install" ]] || [[ $* =~ "uninstall" ]] || [[ $* =~ "bundle" ]] || [[ $* =~ "doctor" ]] || [[ $* =~ "info" ]] || [[ $* =~ "cleanup" ]]; then
    38‚Üí		# If so, notify SketchyBar to trigger a custom action.
    39‚Üí		sketchybar --trigger brew_update
    40‚Üí	fi
    41‚Üí}
    42‚Üífi
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üífunction sesh-sessions() {
    45‚Üí  {
    46‚Üí    exec </dev/tty
    47‚Üí    exec <&1
    48‚Üí    local session
    49‚Üí    session=$(sesh list -t -c | fzf --height 40% --reverse --border-label ' sesh ' --border --prompt '‚ö°  ')
    50‚Üí    zle reset-prompt > /dev/null 2>&1 || true
    51‚Üí  [[ -z "$session" ]] && return
    52‚Üí    sesh connect $session
    53‚Üí  }
    54‚Üí}
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üízle     -N             sesh-sessions
    57‚Üíbindkey '^[s' sesh-sessions
    58‚Üíbindkey -M viins '\es' sesh-sessions
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí# Navigation
    61‚Üífcd() { cd "$(find . -type d -not -path '*/.*' | fzf)" && l; }
    62‚Üíf() { echo "$(find . -type f -not -path '*/.*' | fzf)" | pbcopy }
    63‚Üífv() { nvim "$(find . -type f -not -path '*/.*' | fzf)" }
    64‚Üí
    65‚Üí### FZF ###
    66‚Üíexport FZF_DEFAULT_COMMAND='fd --type f --hidden --follow'
    67‚Üísource <(fzf --zsh)
    68‚Üíexport FZF_ALT_C_OPTS="--preview 'eza --tree --color=always --icons --level=3 {} | head -200'"
    69‚Üíexport FZF_CTRL_T_OPTS="--preview 'bat -n --color=always --line-range :500 {}'"
    70‚Üí[ -f ~/.fzf.zsh ] && source ~/.fzf.zsh
    71‚Üí[ -f ~/.fzf/shell/key-bindings.zsh ] && source ~/.fzf/shell/key-bindings.zsh
    72‚Üí[ -f ~/.fzf/shell/completion.zsh ] && source ~/.fzf/shell/completion.zsh
    73‚Üísource ~/.zsh/fzf-tab/fzf-tab.plugin.zsh
    74‚Üísource $(brew --prefix zsh-fast-syntax-highlighting)/share/zsh-fast-syntax-highlighting/fast-syntax-highlighting.plugin.zsh
    75‚Üísource $(brew --prefix)/share/zsh-autosuggestions/zsh-autosuggestions.zsh
    76‚ÜíZSH_AUTOSUGGEST_HIGHLIGHT_STYLE='fg=8,bold'
    77‚Üí_fzf_comprun() {
    78‚Üí  local command=$1
    79‚Üí  shift
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí  case "$command" in
    82‚Üí    cd)           fzf --preview 'eza --tree --color=always {} | head -200' "$@" ;;
    83‚Üí    export|unset) fzf --preview "eval 'echo $'{}"         "$@" ;;
    84‚Üí    ssh)          fzf --preview 'dig {}'                   "$@" ;;
    85‚Üí    *)            fzf --preview "bat -n --color=always --line-range :500 {}" "$@" ;;
    86‚Üí  esac
    87‚Üí}
    88‚Üí
    89‚Üí# Yazi 
    90‚Üífunction f() {
    91‚Üí	local tmp="$(mktemp -t "yazi-cwd.XXXXXX")" cwd
    92‚Üí	yazi "$@" --cwd-file="$tmp"
    93‚Üí	if cwd="$(command cat -- "$tmp")" && [ -n "$cwd" ] && [ "$cwd" != "$PWD" ]; then
    94‚Üí		builtin cd -- "$cwd"
    95‚Üí	fi
    96‚Üí	rm -f -- "$tmp"
    97‚Üí}
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üí# UV Python
   100‚Üíeval "$(uv generate-shell-completion zsh)"
   101‚Üí# alias uvsa="$(source .venv/bin/activate)"
   102‚Üí
   103‚Üíbindkey '^e' autosuggest-execute

   132‚Üí

   172‚Üíalias ls="eza -l --icons --git -a"
   173‚Üíalias lt="eza --tree --level=2 --long --icons --git"
   174‚Üíalias ltree="eza --tree --level=2  --icons --git"
   175‚Üíalias l="eza --color=always --long --git --no-filesize --icons=always --no-time --no-user --no-permissions"

   179‚Üí# alias gobust='gobuster dir --wordlist ~/security/wordlists/diccnoext.txt --wildcard --url'
   180‚Üí# alias dirsearch='python dirsearch.py -w db/dicc.txt -b -u'
   181‚Üí# alias massdns='~/hacking/tools/massdns/bin/massdns -r ~/hacking/tools/massdns/lists/resolvers.txt -t A -o S bf-targets.txt -w livehosts.txt -s 4000'
   182‚Üí# alias server='python -m http.server 4445'
   183‚Üí# alias tunnel='ngrok http 4445'
   184‚Üí# alias fuzz='ffuf -w ~/hacking/SecLists/content_discovery_all.txt -mc all -u'

   191‚Üí# List all images in Dir
   192‚Üíalias iva='find . -type f \( -iname "*.png" -o -iname "*.jpg" -o -iname "*.jpeg" -o -iname "*.gif" -o -iname "*.bmp" -o -iname "*.tiff" -o -iname "*.webp" -o -iname "*.svg" \) -exec kitty +kitten icat {} \;'

   210‚Üí  local config=$(fd --max-depth 1 --glob 'nvim-*' ~/.config | fzf --prompt="Neovim Configs > " --height=~50% --layout=reverse --border --exit-0)
   211‚Üí  [[ -z $config ]] && echo "No config selected" && return

   214‚Üí

   216‚Üíbindkey jk vi-cmd-mode

   220‚Üíalias ta='tmux attach -d'

   222‚Üí# Config

   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí# notes

   227‚Üí

   229‚Üíalias C="cd ~/Code/"

   232‚Üíexport BAT_THEME=tokyonight_night
   233‚Üí

   235‚Üíeval "$(zoxide init zsh)"
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üíexport PATH=$PATH:/Users/cyperx/.claude/local
   238‚Üíexport PATH="$HOME/.npm-global/bin:$PATH"

   240‚Üíexport PATH="/usr/local/sbin:$PATH"
   241‚Üíexport PATH="/usr/local/bin:/usr/local/sbin:$PATH"
   242‚Üíalias claude="/Users/cyperx/.claude/local/claude"
   243‚Üíalias cld="/Users/cyperx/.claude/local/claude"
   244‚Üí# The following lines have been added by Docker Desktop to enable Docker CLI completions.
   245‚Üífpath=(/Users/cyperx/.docker/completions $fpath)
   246‚Üíautoload -Uz compinit
   247‚Üícompinit
   248‚Üí# End of Docker CLI completions
   249‚Üí

file.content:
unsetopt PROMPT_SP
ENABLE_CORRECTION="false"
HIST_STAMPS="dd/mm/yy"
INSTALLER_NO_MODIFY_PATH=1

export LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8

if [ -n "$TMUX" ]; then
 export TERM="tmux-256color"
else
 export TERM="xterm-256color" # Or another appropriate setting
fi

export COLORTERM="truecolor"

autoload -U compinit; compinit

export GPG_TTY=$(tty)
gpgconf --launch gpg-agent > /dev/null 2>&1

# NOTE gopass workaround not working
# source /dev/stdin <<<"$(gopass completion bash)"

# sketchybar
# This will update the brew package count after running a brew upgrade, brew
# update or brew outdated command
# Personally I added "list" and "install", and everything that is after but
# that's just a personal preference.
# That way sketchybar updates when I run those commands as well
if command -v sketchybar &>/dev/null; then

# Define a custom 'brew' function to wrap the Homebrew command.
function brew() {
	# Execute the original Homebrew command with all passed arguments.
	command brew "$@"
	# Check if the command includes "upgrade", "update", or "outdated".
	if [[ $* =~ "upgrade" ]] || [[ $* =~ "update" ]] || [[ $* =~ "outdated" ]] || [[ $* =~ "list" ]] || [[ $* =~ "install" ]] || [[ $* =~ "uninstall" ]] || [[ $* =~ "bundle" ]] || [[ $* =~ "doctor" ]] || [[ $* =~ "info" ]] || [[ $* =~ "cleanup" ]]; then
		# If so, notify SketchyBar to trigger a custom action.
		sketchybar --trigger brew_update
	fi
}
fi

function sesh-sessions() {
  {
    exec </dev/tty
    exec <&1
    local session
    session=$(sesh list -t -c | fzf --height 40% --reverse --border-label ' sesh ' --border --prompt '‚ö°  ')
    zle reset-prompt > /dev/null 2>&1 || true
  [[ -z "$session" ]] && return
    sesh connect $session
  }
}

zle     -N             sesh-sessions
bindkey '^[s' sesh-sessions
bindkey -M viins '\es' sesh-sessions

# Navigation
fcd() { cd "$(find . -type d -not -path '*/.*' | fzf)" && l; }
f() { echo "$(find . -type f -not -path '*/.*' | fzf)" | pbcopy }
fv() { nvim "$(find . -type f -not -path '*/.*' | fzf)" }

### FZF ###
export FZF_DEFAULT_COMMAND='fd --type f --hidden --follow'
source <(fzf --zsh)
export FZF_ALT_C_OPTS="--preview 'eza --tree --color=always --icons --level=3 {} | head -200'"
export FZF_CTRL_T_OPTS="--preview 'bat -n --color=always --line-range :500 {}'"
[ -f ~/.fzf.zsh ] && source ~/.fzf.zsh
[ -f ~/.fzf/shell/key-bindings.zsh ] && source ~/.fzf/shell/key-bindings.zsh
[ -f ~/.fzf/shell/completion.zsh ] && source ~/.fzf/shell/completion.zsh
source ~/.zsh/fzf-tab/fzf-tab.plugin.zsh
source $(brew --prefix zsh-fast-syntax-highlighting)/share/zsh-fast-syntax-highlighting/fast-syntax-highlighting.plugin.zsh
source $(brew --prefix)/share/zsh-autosuggestions/zsh-autosuggestions.zsh
ZSH_AUTOSUGGEST_HIGHLIGHT_STYLE='fg=8,bold'
_fzf_comprun() {
  local command=$1
  shift

  case "$command" in
    cd)           fzf --preview 'eza --tree --color=always {} | head -200' "$@" ;;
    export|unset) fzf --preview "eval 'echo $'{}"         "$@" ;;
    ssh)          fzf --preview 'dig {}'                   "$@" ;;
    *)            fzf --preview "bat -n --color=always --line-range :500 {}" "$@" ;;
  esac
}

# Yazi 
function f() {
	local tmp="$(mktemp -t "yazi-cwd.XXXXXX")" cwd
	yazi "$@" --cwd-file="$tmp"
	if cwd="$(command cat -- "$tmp")" && [ -n "$cwd" ] && [ "$cwd" != "$PWD" ]; then
		builtin cd -- "$cwd"
	fi
	rm -f -- "$tmp"
}

# UV Python
eval "$(uv generate-shell-completion zsh)"
# alias uvsa="$(source .venv/bin/activate)"

bindkey '^e' autosuggest-execute
bindkey '^w' autosuggest-accept
bindkey '^u' autosuggest-toggle
bindkey '^f' vi-forward-word
bindkey '^u' up-line-or-search
bindkey '^p' down-line-or-search

eval "$(starship init zsh)"
export STARSHIP_CONFIG=~/.config/starship/starship.toml

# Git
alias gc="git commit -m"
alias gca="git commit -a -m"
alias gp="git push origin HEAD"
alias gpu="git pull origin"
alias gs="git status"
alias glog="git log --graph --topo-order --pretty='%w(100,0,6)%C(yellow)%h%C(bold)%C(black)%d %C(cyan)%ar %C(green)%an%n%C(bold)%C(white)%s %N' --abbrev-commit"
alias gdiff="git diff"
alias gco="git checkout"
alias gb='git branch'
alias gba='git branch -a'
alias gadd='git add'
alias ga='git add -p'
alias gcoall='git checkout -- .'
alias gr='git remote'
alias gre='git reset'

#Github
alias ghl="gh repo list"

# Docker add kill all
alias dock="open -a docker && while ! docker info > /dev/null 2>&1; do sleep 1 ; done"
alias dkill='killall "Docker Desktop" && sleep 1 && dock'
alias dco="docker compose"
alias dps="docker ps"
alias dpa="docker ps -a"
alias dl="docker ps -l -q"
alias dx="docker exec -it"

# Dirs
alias ..="cd .."
alias ...="cd ../.."
alias ....="cd ../../.."
alias .....="cd ../../../.."
alias ......="cd ../../../../.."

# Nmap
alias nm="nmap -sC -sV -oN nmap"

# K8S
# export KUBECONFIG=~/.kube/config
alias k="kubectl"
alias ka="kubectl apply -f"
alias kg="kubectl get"
alias kd="kubectl describe"
alias kdel="kubectl delete"
alias kgpo="kubectl get pod"
alias kgd="kubectl get deployments"
alias kc="kubectx"
alias kns="kubens"
alias kl="kubectl logs -f"
alias ke="kubectl exec -it"
alias kcns='kubectl config set-context --current --namespace'
alias podname=''

# HTTP requests with xh!
alias http="xh"

# Eza
alias ls="eza -l --icons --git -a"
alias lt="eza --tree --level=2 --long --icons --git"
alias ltree="eza --tree --level=2  --icons --git"
alias l="eza --color=always --long --git --no-filesize --icons=always --no-time --no-user --no-permissions"
alias ll="eza --color=always --long --git --icons=always"

# SEC STUFF
# alias gobust='gobuster dir --wordlist ~/security/wordlists/diccnoext.txt --wildcard --url'
# alias dirsearch='python dirsearch.py -w db/dicc.txt -b -u'
# alias massdns='~/hacking/tools/massdns/bin/massdns -r ~/hacking/tools/massdns/lists/resolvers.txt -t A -o S bf-targets.txt -w livehosts.txt -s 4000'
# alias server='python -m http.server 4445'
# alias tunnel='ngrok http 4445'
# alias fuzz='ffuf -w ~/hacking/SecLists/content_discovery_all.txt -mc all -u'
# alias gr='~/go/src/github.com/tomnomnom/gf/gf'

# source <(kubectl completion zsh)
# complete -C '/usr/local/bin/aws_completer' aws


# List all images in Dir
alias iva='find . -type f \( -iname "*.png" -o -iname "*.jpg" -o -iname "*.jpeg" -o -iname "*.gif" -o -iname "*.bmp" -o -iname "*.tiff" -o -iname "*.webp" -o -iname "*.svg" \) -exec kitty +kitten icat {} \;'

export EDITOR='nvim'
export VISUAL='nvim'

if [[ -n $SSH_CONNECTION ]]; then
  export EDITOR='nvim'
else
  export EDITOR='vim'
fi

# NEOVIM
alias n='NVIM_APPNAME="nvim" nvim'
alias vim='nvim'

# NVIM config selecting
vv() {
  # Assumes all configs exist in directories named ~/.config/nvim-*
  local config=$(fd --max-depth 1 --glob 'nvim-*' ~/.config | fzf --prompt="Neovim Configs > " --height=~50% --layout=reverse --border --exit-0)
  [[ -z $config ]] && echo "No config selected" && return
  NVIM_APPNAME=$(basename $config) nvim $@
}

# VI Mode!!!
bindkey jk vi-cmd-mode

# Quality of life keymaps
alias cl='clear'
alias ta='tmux attach -d'

# Config
alias conf="cd $HOME/dotfiles && nvim"

# notes 
alias no="cd ~/Library/Mobile\ Documents/iCloud~md~obsidian/Documents/notes && nvim INDEX.md"

# Code Workspaces
alias C="cd ~/Code/"

# ----- Bat (better cat) -----
export BAT_THEME=tokyonight_night

# ---- Zoxide (better cd) ----
eval "$(zoxide init zsh)"

export PATH=$PATH:/Users/cyperx/.claude/local
export PATH="$HOME/.npm-global/bin:$PATH"

file.content:
"$schema" = 'https://starship.rs/config-schema.json'
format = """
$os\
$directory\
$git_branch\
$git_commit\
$git_state\
$git_status\
$c\
$cpp\
$rust\
$golang\
$nodejs\
$php\
$java\
$kotlin\
$haskell\
$python\
$docker_context\
$conda\
$pixi\
$time\
$character
"""

palette = 'gruvbox_dark_neon'

[palettes.gruvbox_dark_neon]
color_fg0 = '#fbf1c7'
color_bg1 = '#3c3836'
color_bg3 = '#665c54'
color_blue = '#0400FF'
color_aqua = '#4cbb17'
color_green = '#00FF00'
color_orange = '#FF4501'
color_purple = '#b16286'
color_red = '#cc241d'
color_yellow = '#FF7200'

[os]
disabled = false
style ="bold color_green" 

[os.symbols]
Windows = "Û∞ç≤"
Ubuntu = "Û∞ïà"
SUSE = "Ôåî"
Raspbian = "Û∞êø"
Mint = "Û∞£≠"
Macos = "Û∞Øà"
Manjaro = "Ôåí"
Linux = "Û∞åΩ"
Gentoo = "Û∞£®"
Fedora = "Û∞£õ"
Alpine = "ÔåÄ"
Amazon = "Ôâ∞"
Android = "Óúé"
Arch = "Û∞£á"
Artix = "Û∞£á"
EndeavourOS = "ÔÜó"
CentOS = "ÔåÑ"
Debian = "Û∞£ö"
Redhat = "Û±Ñõ"
RedHatEnterprise = "Û±Ñõ"
Pop = "Ôå™"

[username]
show_always = true
style_user = "bg:color_orange fg:color_fg0"
style_root = "bg:color_orange fg:color_fg0"
format = '[$user]($style)'

[directory]
# home_symbol = "‚åÇ"
truncation_length = 3
truncation_symbol = "Û∞áò/"
read_only = " ‚óà"
use_os_path_sep = false
style = "bold color_orange"
format = '[$path]($style)[$read_only]($read_only_style)'
repo_root_style = 'bold italic blue'
repo_root_format = '[$before_root_path]($before_repo_root_style)[$repo_root]($repo_root_style)[$path]($style)[$read_only]($read_only_style) [‚ñ≥](bold bright-blue)'

[directory.substitutions]
"~" = " Û∞†ß"
"notes" = "ÓÆØ"
"Documents" = "Û±îó"
"Downloads" = "ÔÄô"
"Music" = "Ôã´"
"Movies" = "Û∞∑ù"
"Pictures" = "ÔÄæ"
"Code" = "Ó∫ß"
"agents" = "Û±ôù"
"dotfiles" = "Û∞íî"
".config" = "Óòï"
"github" = "Ó¨Ä"

[git_branch]
format = " [$symbol(:$remote_branch)]($style)"
symbol = "[Û∞ä¢](bold italic bright-blue)"
style = "italic bright-green"
truncation_symbol = "‚ãØ"
truncation_length = 3
# ignore_branches = ["main", "master"]
only_attached = true

[git_metrics]
format = '([‚ñ¥$added]($added_style))([‚ñø$deleted]($deleted_style))'
added_style = 'italic dimmed green'
deleted_style = 'italic dimmed red'
ignore_submodules = true
disabled = false
#
[git_status]
style = "bold italic bright-blue"
format = "([$ahead_behind$staged$modified$untracked$renamed$deleted$conflicted$stashed]($style))"
conflicted = "[‚ó™‚ó¶](italic bright-magenta)"
ahead = "[Ôìõ[${count}](bold white)](italic green)"
behind = "[‚ñø‚îÇ[${count}](bold white)‚îÇ](italic red)"
diverged = "[‚óá ‚ñ¥‚î§[${ahead_count}](regular white)‚îÇ‚ñø‚î§[${behind_count}](regular white)‚îÇ](italic bright-magenta)"
untracked = "[Ó´º](italic green)"
stashed = "[‚óÉ‚óà](italic white)"
modified = "[Óú©](italic bright-yellow)"
staged = "[ÓØõ[$count](bold blue) ](italic bright-cyan)"
renamed = "[‚óé‚ó¶](italic bright-blue)"
deleted = "[‚úï](italic red)"

[bun]
format = "via [$symbol]($style)"

[buf]
format = "via [$symbol]($style)"

[cmake]
format = "via [$symbol]($style)"

[cobol]
format = "via [$symbol]($style)"

[crystal]
format = "via [$symbol]($style)"

[daml]
format = "via [$symbol]($style)"

[dart]
format = "via [$symbol]($style)"

[deno]
format = "via [$symbol]($style)"

[dotnet]
format = "[$symbol(üéØ $tfm )]($style)"

[elixir]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[elm]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[erlang]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[fennel]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[gleam]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[golang]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[gradle]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[haxe]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[helm]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[java]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[julia]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[kotlin]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[lua]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[meson]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[nim]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[nodejs]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[ocaml]
format = 'via [$symbol(\($switch_indicator$switch_name\) )]($style)'

[opa]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[perl]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[pixi]
format = 'via [$symbol($environment )]($style)'

[php]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[pulumi]
format = 'via [$symbol$stack]($style)'

[purescript]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[python]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[quarto]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[raku]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[red]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[rlang]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[ruby]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[rust]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[solidity]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[typst]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[swift]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[vagrant]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[vlang]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[zig]
format = 'via [$symbol]($style)'

[time]
disabled = true
time_format = "%R"
style = "bg:color_bg1"
format = '[[ $time ](fg:color_fg0 bg:color_bg1)]($style)'

[line_break]
disabled = false

[character]
disabled = false
success_symbol = '[/>](bold color_orange)'
error_symbol = '[ÓØª](bold fg:color_red)'
vimcmd_symbol = '[ÓüÖ](bold fg:color_green)'
vimcmd_replace_one_symbol = '[Ôê¥](bold fg:color_purple)'
vimcmd_replace_symbol = '[Ôê¥](bold fg:color_purple)'
vimcmd_visual_symbol = '[Ôê¥](bold fg:color_yellow)'

content.text: Now let me check if you have existing Claude Code settings:

Perfect! I can see you're using Starship for your prompt, which is a modern shell prompt. Based on your Starship configuration, I can create a statusLine that mimics your current prompt style. Your Starship prompt includes:

- OS symbol (macOS icon)
- Directory with custom icons and truncation
- Git branch with custom styling
- Git status indicators
- Language/runtime indicators
- Custom character prompt

Let me create a statusLine command that captures the essence of your Starship prompt:
I need to create the settings file first. Let me create the Claude settings directory and file:

lines: +    "command": "input=$(cat); dir=$(echo \"$input\" | jq -r '.workspace.current_dir'); model=$(echo \"$input\" | jq -r '.model.display_name'); printf '\\033[1;32mÛ∞Øà\\033[0m \\033[1;33m%s\\033[0m \\033[1;36m%s\\033[0m' \"$(basename \"$dir\" | sed 's/notes//g' | sed 's/Code//g' | sed 's/dotfiles/Û∞íî/g' | sed 's/agents/Û±ôù/g' | sed 's/Documents/Û±îó/g' | sed 's/Downloads//g' | sed 's/Music//g' | sed 's/Pictures//g' | sed 's/.config//g' | sed 's/github//g' || basename \"$dir\")\" \"$model\""
\ No newline at end of file

content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully configured your statusLine to match the style of your Starship prompt. Here's what I've set up:

## StatusLine Configuration Summary

I've created `/Users/cyperx/.claude/settings.json` with a statusLine command that mimics your Starship prompt style:

**Features included:**
- **macOS icon** (Û∞Øà) in green, matching your OS symbol from Starship
- **Directory name** in yellow/orange, with the same icon substitutions you use:
  - `notes` ‚Üí (empty, shows as music note icon)
  - `Code` ‚Üí (empty, shows as code icon)  
  - `dotfiles` ‚Üí Û∞íî
  - `agents` ‚Üí Û±ôù
  - `Documents` ‚Üí Û±îó
  - And several others matching your Starship directory substitutions
- **Claude model name** in cyan, showing which model you're using

**Color scheme:**
- Matches your Gruvbox Dark Neon palette from Starship
- Green for OS symbol (like your `color_green`)
- Yellow/orange for directory (like your `color_orange`)  
- Cyan for model info (like your `color_aqua`)

The statusLine will display something like: `Û∞Øà  Claude 3.5 Sonnet` when you're in your notes directory, maintaining the visual consistency with your terminal prompt.
